definition: to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Enough is enough they say - it's time to fight back.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲惡作劇的時間已經夠了，現在是時候回擊了。

sentences.english: A composite formula for calculation of horizontal electric field generated by return stroke current is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一種計算地閃回擊電流水平電場的混合法。

sentences.english: After we fired back, there was no further response from the DRPK.
sentences.chinese: 我方回擊後，朝方沒有進一步迴應。

sentences.english: We replied to the enemy's attack with a barrage.
sentences.chinese: 我軍以齊射的炮火回擊敵軍的進攻。

sentences.english: The player should learn to use a cross over step to recover from wide balls.
sentences.chinese: 選手應學習在回擊大外角球來球后，以交叉跨步回防。

sentences.english: To which there seemed no more effectual reply than to go on killing royalists.
sentences.chinese: 除了繼續殺害保王黨人，似乎沒有別的更有效的回擊。

sentences.english: The Mon Calamari and the Quarren joined together to fight back against the invaders.
sentences.chinese: 蒙卡拉馬里人與誇潤人聯手回擊了入侵者。

sentences.english: The Americans returned fire with heavy machine guns and grenade launchers.
sentences.chinese: 美國人用重機槍和榴彈發射器回擊。

sentences.english: Johnson returns it crosscourt , deep to the right baseline comer.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜打出斜線球回擊，球打到了底線右角。

sentences.english: The Club World Cup champions cannot possibly reply to the newly-promoted Juventus.
sentences.chinese: 世俱杯冠軍也許無法回擊升班馬尤文圖斯。

sentences.english: He was out trying to turn a ball to leg.
sentences.chinese: 他想把球回擊到擊球員左後方場地，結果出局了。

sentences.english: This is a good chance to strike back your political opponent.
sentences.chinese: 這正是回擊你的政敵的好機會。

sentences.english: Srk's reply to critics that say he has only 5 expressions that he keeps repeating.
sentences.chinese: 沙沙回擊評論家批評他一直在重複五種表達方式。

sentences.english: The Gaddafi fighters hitting back with heavy weapons.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲的士兵用重武器回擊。

sentences.english: What made it different is that officials fought back hard for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 與以往不同的是，這次官員首次進行了有力的回擊。

sentences.english: Now and then the Nietzsches of the world have fought back.
sentences.chinese: 不時地，世界上這些尼采的追隨者正在回擊。

definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom)/fig. to achieve much with little effort
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
counting one's chickens before they are hatched
to shift one's eyes/(fig.) to shift one's attention/to divert attention
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
